title: Sheet Pan Seafood Boil Recipe
description: This simple roasted sheet pan dinner provides all the yummy flavors of a seafood boil with much less effort.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Main Dishes Seafood Main Dishes Sheet Pan Seafood Boil 4.2 (6) 6 Reviews 6 Photos All the yummy flavors of a seafood boil with less effort. Just roast your seafood in the oven in a flavored butter sauce. Serve with crusty bread. Submitted by Bites With Applewhite Updated on August 29, 2023 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 6 6 6 6 Prep Time: 30 mins Cook Time: 30 mins Additional Time: 1 hr Total Time: 2 hrs Servings: 4 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings 1 (16 ounce) package littleneck clams ¾ cup unsalted butter 2 heads garlic, chopped 1 tablespoon Cajun seasoning 1 tablespoon lemon and herb seafood seasoning ½ tablespoon cayenne pepper 1 pound uncooked medium shrimp, peeled and deveined 1 pound Snow Crab legs 2 lobster tails, split in half lengthwise 4 andouille sausage links, cut into quarters 3 ears corn, cut into chunks Directions Remove grit from clams by soaking in salt water for 20 minutes. Repeat this step twice. Scrub shells clean. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Melt butter in a medium saucepan over low heat with garlic, Cajun seasoning, seafood seasoning, and cayenne until garlic is fragrant, 1 to 2 minutes. Remove from heat. Place clams, shrimp, crab, and lobster on a sheet pan. Add sausage and corn. Pour seasoned butter over and mix to ensure all is covered. Bake in the preheated oven until shrimp just turns opaque, clams open, and sausage is browned, 25 to 30 minutes. Recipe Tip Discard any clams that do not open after cooking. Add Your Photo Photos of Sheet Pan Seafood Boil 01 of 06 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 06 Photo by  DREGINEK 07/04/2022 This is a 5 star flavor but the ingredients and steps don’t totally make sense. Where do the kidney beans (1 tsp?) and the Castelvetrano olives go in? Into the butter sauce? At the end? Totally lost so skipped. Also, in step 3, talks about seafood seasoning but that’s not in the list of ingredients? I took this to mean Old Bay - which I added, and used 3/4 TBLS each of both Creole and Old Bay. Skipped the clams but used prawns - basically very large shrimp and added a rough chopped onion. Cook time was spot on (27 min) for the meatiness of the seafood I had. We oohed and awwed at every bite. Better than any boil! We will absolutely make this again! Thank you!! 03 of 06 Photo by  Elizabeth 12/22/2021 We loved this recipe! It turns out so much better than boiling it for sure. I just make mine with clams, shrimp and andouille sausage. I also like to add some potatoes to ours and serve with crusty bread to soak up the juices. I make individual foil packets so everyone gets their own for dinner. Making it in the oven makes it so easy! 04 of 06 Photo by  Elizabeth 12/22/2021 We loved this recipe! It turns out so much better than boiling it for sure. I just make mine with clams, shrimp and andouille sausage. I also like to add some potatoes to ours and serve with crusty bread to soak up the juices. I make individual foil packets so everyone gets their own for dinner. Making it in the oven makes it so easy! 05 of 06 Photo by  Bites With Applewhite 09/01/2020 1 You’ll Also Love Old Bay Seafood Boil 10 Ratings Louisiana Crawfish Boil 26 Ratings Air Fryer Shrimp "Boil" 9 Ratings Stuffed Salmon 4 Ratings Instant Pot Live Crawfish Boil for Four 1 Rating Cindy's Jambalaya 846 Ratings Frutti Di Mare 2 Ratings Sheet Pan Salmon and Potatoes 5 Ratings Salmon Stuffed with Crab and Lobster 2 Ratings Bacon Shrimp Scampi 4 Ratings Mom's Nova Scotia Seafood Chowder 94 Ratings Laura's Seafood Thermidor 9 Ratings Grilled Shrimp with Fresh Tomato Sauce and Angel Hair Pasta 3 Ratings Seafood Lasagna 72 Ratings Seafood Newburg 65 Ratings Amazing Seafood Pasta with Lobster 2 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Bites With Applewhite
instructions: Remove grit from clams by soaking in salt water for 20 minutes. Repeat this step twice. Scrub shells clean.;Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).;Melt butter in a medium saucepan over low heat with garlic, Cajun seasoning, seafood seasoning, and cayenne until garlic is fragrant, 1 to 2 minutes. Remove from heat.;Place clams, shrimp, crab, and lobster on a sheet pan. Add sausage and corn. Pour seasoned butter over and mix to ensure all is covered.;Bake in the preheated oven until shrimp just turns opaque, clams open, and sausage is browned, 25 to 30 minutes.
